chapter.name: Digital
chapter.par: Digital is a simple simulator used to simulate digital circuits. The single logic gates are connected to each other by wires and the behaviour of the whole circuit is simulated. The user is able to interact with the circuit while it is running by pressing buttons or setting values to the inputs of the circuit.

In this way you can build and simulate most of the fundamental circuits used in digital electronics. In the folder examples you can find many examples including a working single cycle harvard 16 bit processor.

chapter.name: Propagation Delay
chapter.par: During the simulation every logic gate has a propagation delay. Every component from the library has the same propagation delay regardless of its complexity. So a NOT gate has the same propagation delay as a RAM component or a flipflop. The only exceptions are diodes, switches and splitters which are used to create data buses. These components have no propagation delay at all.

If a circuit is included in an other parent circuit, the included circuit keep its timing behaviour. So if you include a complex circuit which has a large propagation delay because on of the inputt signals has to pass three gates until it reaches the output, this behaviour is conserved while including this circuit. There are no additional delays coming up by including a circuit. If not all outputs of a circuit have the same propagation delay this is also the case if it is included in a parent circuit. In general, including a circuit into an other circuit does not modify its timing behaviour at all. A included circuit behave in exact the same way as if all components had been inserted in the same circuit level.

chapter.name: Wires
chapter.par: There are only connections between the end of a wire and a components pin. If you draw a straight wire across many component pins, there will be no connection between the pins and the wire at all.

faq.question: How to move a wire?
faq.answer: Select on of the end points with the rectangular selection. The move this point using the mouse.

faq.question: How to select a single wire?
faq.answer: You have to select the end points of the wire using the rectangular selection.

faq.question: How to delete a wire?
faq.answer: Select on of the end points and press DEL or click on the trashcan.

faq.question: How to move a component including all the connected wires?
faq.answer: Select the component with the rectangular selection. The selection must include the entire component. Then move the component including the wires using the mouse.

faq.question: There is a component not connected to a wire, even though the pins are on the wire.
faq.answer: A pin is only connected to a wire if the wire has an endpoint at the pin.

faq.question: When the simulation is started, a wire becomes gray. What does that mean?
faq.answer: The colors light green and dark green are used to represent high and low state. Gray means the wire is in high Z state.

faq.question: I have a truth table. How to calculate the minimized boolean equations?
faq.answer: In the menu Analysis select the entry Synthesise. Then enter the truth table. At the bottom of the window you can find the matching boolean equation. If you enter more than one dependent variable, a new window opens in which all boolean equations are shown.

faq.question: I have entered a truth table, but there are more then one boolean equation shown. Which of them is the correct one?
faq.answer: Minimizing a boolean equation can result in many equations, describing the same function. Digital shows all of them and they all create the same truth table. There may be differences according the don't cares in the truth table.

faq.question: I have a truth table. How to create a circuit representing the truth table?
faq.answer: In the menu Analysis select the entry Synthesise. Then enter the truth table. You can edit the table using the New or Add Columns menus. In the menu Create you can create a circuit using the Circuit item.

faq.question: How to edit a signals name in the truth table?
faq.answer: Double click the name in the table header and edit the name.

faq.question: I have a boolean equation. How to create a circuit?
faq.answer: In the menu Analysis select the entry Expression. Then enter the expression.

faq.question: How to create a truth table from an boolean equation?
faq.answer: In the menu Analysis select the entry Expression. Then enter the expression. Then create a circuit and in the menu Analysis use the entry Analysis to create the truth table.

faq.question: How to create a JEDEC file from a given circuit?
faq.answer: In the menu Analysis select the entry Analysis. Then in the menu Create of the new window choose the correct device in the sub menu Device.

faq.question: When creating a JEDEC file: How to assign a pin number to a certain signal?
faq.answer: At the according inputs and outputs you can enter a Description. In this description you can add a line 'Pin [n]', where [n] gives the pin number. If there is no such line, the next available pin is assigned to the signal.

faq.question: I have created a JEDEC file. How to program it to a GAL16v8 or GAL22v10?
faq.answer: To programm such a chip a special programmer hardware is necessary.
